lead_paragraph: KIMBALL--Arthur Ogden. (1931-2016), formerly associated with Columbia University School of Law for thirty-two years, succumbed to a decade of major illnesses shortly after his 85th birthday. Early in the 1960s at the invitation of the late William C. Warren, then Dean, he served as Director of Development. Later, simultaneously as Associate Dean; in addition to steering the Board of Visitors, as well being active on several non-profit boards; last being the Archives of American Art, a bureau of the Smithsonian. He was a longtime member of Phi Beta Kappa (400) and the University Club. Colby College in Waterville, ME (his birthplace) awarded him one of three scholarships. He graduated Cum Laude to follow with an M.B.A. from Columbia's Business School prior to joining the Law School. Retirement was spent in Williamsburg, VA with his wife of 58 years, Bernice. Memorials may be made to the Arthur Kimball Scholarship Endowment Fund, Columbia University School of Law, 435 West 116th Street, New York, NY 10027, established in his honor some thirty years ago by a group of the school's law alumni. 1/3
